data.meta_description:
Truly an honor - thank you Hematology/Oncology Pharmacy Association (HOPA)  for awarding the Basic Science and Clinical Research Literature Award!

data.text:
#MAPSEMEA24 delegates: Are you looking to improve the impact of integrated evidence generation planning? üí° Join one of two interactive workshops (Monday 13 May and Tuesday 14 May). Integrated evidence generation plans (IEGPs) should be living documents that are regularly updated to meet the evolving needs of healthcare decision-makers. Join this workshop‚Äôs expert panel for interactive exercises and debates, exploring: ‚ùî What does a fit-for-purpose IEGP development cycle look like? ‚ùî What are the key challenges to IEGP development, including the implications of changing evidence demands by HTAs, joint regulations and orphan disease incentives? ‚ùî How can we measure the impact of an IEGP? When? ‚û° Monday 13 May, 10:45‚Äì12:15 UTC+1 ‚û° Tuesday 14 May, 13:00‚Äì14:30 UTC+1 Speakers: Cerise James, MD, MPH (MAPS Ev Gen FAWG Co Lead), Judith Nelissen (Astellas), Angela Williams (Kyowa Kirin International) and #OxfordPharmaGenesis Communications Director Gary Male. #ExploreNewFrontiers

Exclusive webinar: WHO goes eCTD! With the launch of the ePQS Portal, the World Health Organization (WHO) will reach another milestone in the digitalization and streamlining of business processes: With Phase 1, companies will be able to make submissions via eCTD. WHO is thus following the example of numerous international health authorities, such as the EMA. WHO and EXTEDO have joint forces in a very special webinar! We are pleased to present this important development to you in an exclusive free webinar, to which we cordially invite you. Join us as WHO representatives talk about the introduction of eCTD and what it means for the future of submissions. Learn from EXTEDO expert Frank Dickert what exactly the WHO Module 1 and the validation criteria look like, and see in a live demo by our product manager, Maren M√ºller, how easy it is to create and validate a WHO eCTD dossier in EXTEDOpulse. Date: 21 November 2023 Time: 11:00 - 12:30 CET Register now and learn how your organization can approach the future of submissions. Secure your spot in this outstanding event and receive the recording: https://lnkd.in/dnVMj-pq #WHO #EXTEDO #EXTEDOpulse #eCTD
